mechanoreception.notes: Sponges generally possess mechanoreceptors that allow them to respond to physical stimuli in their environment. Given that Aplysinellidae is a family of sponges, mechanoreception is inferred to be present.

chemoreception.notes: Sponges are known to use chemoreception to detect chemical cues in the water, aiding in filter feeding and other processes. This is inferred to be present in Aplysinellidae.

photoreception.notes: There is no direct evidence from the provided text regarding photoreception in Aplysinellidae. It is unknown if they possess this sense.
